meanings.definition: To supply with a continuous flow or stream of something.
meanings.sent1: The river infeeds water into the lake.
meanings.sent2: The automatic feeder infeeds food to the fish tank.
meanings.sent3: The conveyor belt infeeds materials to the assembly line.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude infeeds motivation to the team.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight infeeds warmth to the plants, helping them grow.

meanings.definition: To provide with a constant source of nourishment or energy.
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy meals infeeds the body with essential nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The solar panels infeeds electricity to the house.
meanings.sent3: His jokes infeeds laughter to the group.
meanings.sent4: Music infeeds joy to the listeners' hearts.
meanings.sent5: Exercise infeeds energy to the muscles, making them stronger.
